groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Tab 01 - RealTimeOS Core

The RealTime Operating System

It is not software, not a methodology, and not just automation. It is a real-time, living future-of-work operating model that delivers peak performance, increased value, and measurable outcomes.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts->Dimensions->Digital Assets->Agentic Factory->Digital Workforce->Digital Twin->New Fact

groups.label: Core Elements
groups.html:
Facts

What it is: A real event with a time, source, and owner.

Why it matters: Work should start from what actually happened.

Output: A recorded event that can be acted on.

Dimensions

What it is: Context fields on the fact: who, where, urgency, risk, value, and jurisdiction.

Why it matters: Context tells the system what to do first.

Output: A fact that is ready to route.

Digital Assets

What it is: The thing affected by the fact: customer, contract, system, document, device, or queue.

Why it matters: You can see what changed and who owns it.

Output: Updated asset data linked to the event.

Agentic Factory

What it is: The layer that runs agents, genies, and streams.

Why it matters: It moves work from start to finish in the right order.

Output: Work completed with a clear execution record.

Digital Workforce

What it is: Human workers and digital workers working together.

Why it matters: Digital workers add speed, humans add judgment.

Output: Work completed with approvals and ownership.

Digital Twin

What it is: A live view of current state and recent changes.

Why it matters: Teams can see what is happening now and what just changed.

Output: Current state plus a usable history.

New Fact

What it is: The result captured as the next fact.

Why it matters: It closes the loop and starts the next cycle.

Output: The workflow continues with updated state.

groups.label: The Operating Loop
groups.html:
A Single, Closed, Continuous Pipeline

  1. A real event is captured as a Fact.
  2. Dimensions add context to the fact.
  3. The fact is linked to the right Digital Asset.
  4. The Agentic Factory routes and orchestrates the response.
  5. The Digital Workforce executes the required work.
  6. The Digital Twin updates current state and history.
  7. The result is captured as a New Fact, and the loop continues.

groups.label: Why RealTime Operating System Works for Any Business
groups.html:
• Starts from facts: Teams work from what actually happened, not assumptions.
  • Uses one workflow: Every function follows the same operating loop.
  • Improves response speed: Work can move in real time, not days later.
  • Creates traceability: Decisions, actions, and outcomes are all recorded.
  • Supports step-by-step automation: You can shift work from human to digital safely.
  • Gives one operating view: Assets and events are visible across the business.
?
The universal truth: Every business runs on events (facts), applies context (dimensions), updates entities (digital assets), makes decisions (agentic factory), and executes work (hybrid workers). RealTimeOS simply makes this explicit, traceable, and optimizable.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Tab 02 - Strategic Pillars

Strategic Pillars

How the RealTime Operating System creates value across core business domains. Each pillar applies the same workflow in a different operating context.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts->Dimensions->Digital Assets->Agentic Factory->Digital Workforce->Digital Twin->New Fact

groups.label: Commercial Verticals
groups.html:
Pillar 01
Transformation Studio - Continuous Operations Delivery
  • Commercial focus: Transform companies through AI, automation, and agency delivery services.
  • Core delivery: Fully autonomous and robotic solutions for key verticals: health, manufacturing, and BPO.
  • How value is created: Faster launches, verticalized solutions, continuous delivery, and live operations.
  • Revenue path: MRR from core solutions, value streams, and modular operations.
Pillar 02
Managed Intelligent Provider - Transform from MSP to MIP
  • Commercial focus: Move from MSP to MIP through real-time, intelligent service operations.
  • Core delivery: AI-enabled and autonomous operations with personalized service and support.
  • How value is created: Technology is the enabler; client outcomes and service quality are the priority.
  • Revenue path: MRR per user and per location, plus layered value-stream revenue.
Pillar 03
Real-Time Business Intelligence - Visual Management, Planning & Simulation
  • Commercial focus: Turn live operational data into visible, decision-ready business intelligence.
  • Core delivery: Visual management, analytics, planning, and simulation across business domains.
  • How value is created: Faster decisions, earlier risk detection, and better planning accuracy.
  • Revenue path: MRR for BI dashboards, analytics packages, planning modules, and simulation modules.
Pillar 04
Intelligent Buildings - Physical Operations & Robotics
  • Commercial focus: Modernize physical operations with real-time control and automation.
  • Core delivery: Building systems, robotics, sensors, and site workflows in one operating model.
  • How value is created: Lower downtime, lower energy cost, faster response, and safer operations.
  • Revenue path: Deployment fees + MRR per site, per device group, and per value-stream type.
Pillar 05
LiveOps - Modular Continuous Operations
  • Commercial focus: Run modular back-of-house operations for companies in real time.
  • Core delivery: A live command center that handles day-to-day operations, escalations, and service flow.
  • How value is created: Faster response, fewer misses, and consistent service quality.
  • Revenue path: MRR per seat, per service, per transaction, and per value-stream type.
?
The meta-pillar: All five tenets use the same RealTimeOS loop. Transformation Studio builds and maintains the platform. MIP handles IT facts. Business Intelligence turns fact streams into insight. Intelligent Buildings handles physical facts. LiveOps orchestrates human work. The pattern never changes - only the domain of application.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Tab 03 - Transformation Fund

Transformation Fund

The Transformation Fund applies the RealTimeOS model to real companies and real operations. We invest where execution is weak, then improve performance using one operating workflow.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts->Dimensions->Digital Assets->Agentic Factory->Digital Workforce->Digital Twin->New Fact

groups.label: Transformation Fund Strategy
groups.html:
Strategy Focus

  • Commercial focus: Buy, invest, or partner in companies with operational upside.
  • Core delivery: Deploy RealTimeOS to stabilize operations, reduce waste, and improve speed.
  • How value is created: Better output, lower COGS, faster decisions, and stronger EBITDA.
  • Target profile: SMB and mid-market companies with fragmented workflows and clear improvement potential.

groups.label: Investment Opportunities
groups.html:
Opportunity Types

  • Commercial focus: Invest in opportunities where operations can be rebuilt with RealTimeOS.
  • Core delivery: Minority stakes, majority acquisitions, and joint ventures.
  • How value is created: Faster transformation after close and stronger margin performance.
  • Revenue path: Equity upside, cash-flow gains, and exit value growth.

groups.label: Global Focus
groups.html:
Global Execution Model

  • Commercial focus: Build a global portfolio using one operating model across regions.
  • Core delivery: Standard RealTimeOS deployment, then localize for regulation and workforce context.
  • How value is created: Reuse proven patterns, cut rollout time, and improve cross-border consistency.
  • Operating scope: Health, manufacturing, BPO, and other event-driven verticals.

groups.label: Value Creation & Returns
groups.html:
Return Model

  • Commercial focus: Improve operating results quickly and hold for strategic exit timing.
  • Core delivery: Hands-on execution over a 12-18 month transformation cycle.
  • How value is created: Margin expansion, cash-flow lift, and valuation multiple growth.
  • Return target: 3-5x outcomes across the portfolio lifecycle.
?
Why this fund succeeds: RealTimeOS is our proprietary transformation engine. We execute the same model across every deal, prove value fast, and scale the portfolio with repeatable operating patterns.

Example Transformation Path

Year 0 (Entry): Manufacturing company at $10M revenue with high COGS and fragmented operations.

Year 1 (Deployment):

  • MIP: reduce IT support costs by 40%.
  • LiveOps: centralize operational control and back-office flow.
  • Intelligent Buildings: automate warehouse steps and reduce energy by 25%.
  • Result: COGS drops from 35% to 22%; EBITDA grows from $1M to $3.5M.

Year 2 (Scale and Exit):

  • RealTimeOS Intelligence identifies the next expansion lane.
  • Revenue expands to $15M on nearly the same cost base.
  • Exit improves from 4x to 8x EBITDA valuation context.
  • Fund return: 7x in 24 months.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Tab 04 - Revenue Model

Revenue Model & Strategic Anchors

The path to $50k MRR by mid-2026, 5 active clients by end-2026, and fund launch readiness. Multiple revenue streams compounding toward profitability and scalability.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts->Dimensions->Digital Assets->Agentic Factory->Digital Workforce->Digital Twin->New Fact

groups.label: Strategic Anchors (Non-Negotiable Targets)
groups.html:
The Three Anchors

  1. $50,000 AUD MRR by mid-2026 - Recurring revenue proving business model viability
  2. 5 active RealTimeOS clients by end-2026 - Portfolio demonstrating replicability across verticals
  3. Fund launch readiness - Track record, deal flow, LP relationships established

Current state (Feb 2026): $38.5k MRR, 4 active clients, fund thesis documented

groups.label: Revenue Streams
groups.html:
Current State (Now)

  • Business reset: Stabilized and transformed a failing MSP into a viable RealTimeOS operation.
  • Commercial proof: 2 active RealTimeOS Transformation Studio clients now validate the model.
  • Revenue base: Existing managed operations revenue keeps the business stable while we scale the next offer.
  • Priority: Shift from reactive service work to repeatable transformation delivery.

Future State (Target)

  • Primary engine: Transformation Studio becomes the lead offer and top growth driver.
  • Commercial outcome: Higher-value client relationships, faster revenue growth, and stronger margins.
  • Portfolio motion: Every Studio engagement opens expansion into additional RealTimeOS modules.
  • Operating direction: Build a transformation-led business with recurring revenue and modular growth paths.

Growth Design (What We Push)

  • Core push: RealTimeOS Transformation Studio.
  • Support lanes: MIP and Intelligent Buildings are expansion lanes, not the front-door offer.
  • How value grows: Studio delivers the transformation plan, then implementation extends into operations, automation, and monitoring.
  • Commercial options: Per program, per module, per location, and ongoing MRR value streams.

Go-To-Market Focus

  • Vertical opportunities: Target health, manufacturing, BPO, and service-heavy businesses with fragmented operations.
  • Focused campaigns: Run industry-specific campaigns tied to clear operational outcomes and fast wins.
  • Rainmaker network: Build trusted relationships with lawyers, accountants, tax advisors, investors, and board-level operators who open qualified doors.
  • Referral channels: Partner referrals, client referrals, and rainmaker introductions that place us into active transformation programs.

Revenue Path (Simple View)

  • Stage 1: Transformation Studio projects create immediate commercial momentum.
  • Stage 2: Convert wins into recurring operations revenue.
  • Stage 3: Expand into modular value streams by function, site, and business unit.
  • Stage 4: Use performance proof to support fund growth and larger transformation plays.

groups.label: Unit Economics & Path to Profitability
groups.html:
Current State Economics

  • Position: Stable base business with proven delivery capability.
  • Strength: Real client outcomes and repeatable operating structure.
  • Gap: Growth is constrained if we keep selling only traditional managed services.
  • Decision: Put commercial weight behind Transformation Studio.

Future State Economics

  • Position: Transformation-led revenue model with higher margin profile.
  • Growth model: Studio-first sales, then recurring operations and modular expansion.
  • Scale model: More revenue per client without linear headcount growth.
  • Reinvestment: Fund buildout, new modules, and global expansion readiness.
?
Revenue growth summary: We stabilized and transformed a dead MSP, proved demand with Transformation Studio clients, and now use Studio as the main commercial engine. That engine lifts every other RealTimeOS offer and builds stronger long-term value streams.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Tab 05 - The Flywheel

The Flywheel & Long-Term Direction

How everything compounds. Each component reinforces the others, creating momentum that accelerates over time. The more we build, the faster we build. The more we deploy, the better we get. The better we get, the more valuable we become.

RealTimeOS Operating Chain - Core
Facts->Dimensions->Digital Assets->Agentic Factory->Digital Workforce->Digital Twin->New Fact

groups.label: The Compounding Effect
groups.html:
How Each Element Feeds the Next

  1. Transformation Studio wins and designs the transformation.
  2. MIP stabilizes and operationalizes service delivery.
  3. Intelligent Buildings extends execution into physical operations.
  4. Real-Time Intelligence drives planning, analytics, and decisions.
  5. More AI adds new agents, genies, and streams, then repeats the loop.
?
The insight: Transformation Studio leads. MIP operationalizes. Intelligent Buildings expands execution. Real-Time Intelligence sharpens decisions. Then we add more AI and repeat. That is the flywheel.

groups.label: Long-Term Direction
groups.html:
Stabilize and Prove the Model

  • Stabilize delivery and prove repeatable transformation outcomes.
  • Show that the model works across clients and use cases.
  • Build a trusted commercial track record.
  • Outcome: A proven operating business that stands on its own.

Scale the Business

  • Scale Transformation Studio and expand recurring value streams.
  • Use delivery proof to increase deal quality and market trust.
  • Grow operational capacity without losing execution quality.
  • Outcome: A scaled business with stronger margin and momentum.

Fund Becomes the Primary Value Driver

  • Use the fund to acquire and transform companies directly.
  • Build portfolio value through operating execution, not only advisory work.
  • Turn the model into owned assets and long-horizon enterprise value.
  • Outcome: Fund-led ownership becomes the main growth engine.
?
Blue-sky direction: Agencies may want to acquire us, but that is not the core endgame. The core endgame is the fund owning and transforming companies at scale.
